Package viewer

Class Viewer

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
viewer.Viewer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
BBFullPreview
public class Viewer
extends javax.swing.JFrame
Viewer sets up and creates the GUI for displaying the billboards.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Viewer

      public Viewer() throws java.awt.HeadlessException
      Constructor method for Viewer class.
      Throws:
      java.awt.HeadlessException - Thrown when code that is dependent on a keyboard, display, or mouse is called in an environment that does not support a keyboard, display, or mouse.

  • Method Details

    • extractXMLFile

      public static org.w3c.dom.Document extractXMLFile​(int fileNum) throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException, java.io.IOException, org.xml.sax.SAXException
      Parses in the xml file from a mock "database", that we want to display from the given test xml files. These xml files are stored in resources. The mock database simply stores the file names.
      Parameters:
      fileNum - An int which is the file name (number), of the example xml files from the mock "database".
      Returns:
      Returns a Document object which is the xml file, so that the xml tags can be extracted.
      Throws:
      javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Throws an exception if there is an error from either the XML parser or the application.
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      org.xml.sax.SAXException - Throws an exception if there is a serious configuration error.

    • extractDataFromXML

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> extractDataFromXML​(org.w3c.dom.Document xmlDoc, byte[] pictureData)
      Extracts data from an xml file for creating the billboard. It gets the content from the message, picture and information tags as well as the custom colours for specified the billboard.

      Note if the byte array is non-empty then picture will be 'present' and picture type will be 'byte'.

      Parameters:
      xmlDoc - An xml file as a Document, from which to extract information from.
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute, instead of in the xml (only occurs when xml file is incoming from server).
      Returns:
      Returns a HashMap(String, String) which stores the background colour, message, message colour, picture, picture type (url, data or byte), information, and information colour of the billboard, if there is no content for one or more of these tags, the string is null.

    • readByteArrayToPicture

      public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage readByteArrayToPicture​(byte[] pictureData)
      This function reads in a byte array which represents an image as a BufferedImage and returns this.
      Parameters:
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute, instead of in the xml (only occurs, when xml file is incoming from server).
      Returns:
      Returns a BufferedImage which is the picture stored in the byte array.

    • readPictureFromFile

      public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage readPictureFromFile​(java.lang.String picture, java.lang.String pictureType)
      Reads in a picture from a file based on whether it is url or data and returns it in a form so that it can be displayed properly on the billboard.
      Parameters:
      picture - A String which is the picture to read in, this could be in the form of a url or data attribute
      pictureType - A String which is either url or data, so that we can decode the image
      Returns:
      Returns the picture as a BufferedImage so it can be displayed on the billboard. Returns null if the picture cannot be read in.

    • getScaledImage

      public static java.awt.Image getScaledImage​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, double maxImageWidth, double maxImageHeight)
      Scales the given image to be no larger than the provided maximum width and no larger than the maximum height.
      Parameters:
      image - A BufferedImage which is the image that needs to be scaled.
      maxImageWidth - A double which represents the largest width the image can be displayed as on the screen.
      maxImageHeight - A double which represents the largest height the image can be displayed as on the screen.
      Returns:
      Returns an Image which is the scaled version of the input image.

    • getMessageFontSize

      public int getMessageFontSize​(java.lang.String message, double maxStringHeight)
      Calculates the largest font size for the message string, which must fit on one line on the screen.
      Parameters:
      message - A String which is the message display on the screen.
      maxStringHeight - A double which is the maximum height the message can be displayed as
      Returns:
      Returns an int which is the largest font size that the message can be displayed at

    • setInformationFontSize

      public void setInformationFontSize​(double maxStringHeight, boolean message)
      Calculates and sets the largest font size for the information string so that the text fills up no more than 50% of the screen's height. The information font size is always smaller than the message font size.
      Parameters:
      maxStringHeight - A double which is the maximum height the string can be.
      message - A boolean which is true if there is a message displayed on the screen and false if there isn't.

    • getInformationHTMLString

      public static java.lang.String getInformationHTMLString​(java.lang.String information, int maxStringWidth)
      Returns a string which formats the information string so that the text is wrapped, centered, and does not exceed the maximum string width. This can then be used when setting the information label text.
      Parameters:
      information - A String of the information to format for displaying.
      maxStringWidth - An int which is the maximum string width for information string.
      Returns:
      Returns the formatted HTML version of information string.

    • setUpMessage

      public double setUpMessage​(java.lang.String message, double maxStringHeight)
      Sets up the message so that it can be added to the billboard and returns the height of the message label for formatting and spacing purposes.
      Parameters:
      message - A String which stores the message to display.
      maxStringHeight - A double which is the maximum height the message can be dispayed at.
      Returns:
      Returns a double which represents the height of the message.

    • setUpPicture

      public double setUpPicture​(java.lang.String picture, java.lang.String pictureType, byte[] pictureData, double maxImageWidth, double maxImageHeight)
      Sets up the picture so that it can be added to the billboard, given a maximum image width and height. Returns the height of the picture for formatting and spacing purposes.
      Parameters:
      picture - A String which stores the picture to display.
      pictureType - A String which specifies the type of picture, either as a "url", "data" or "byte".
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute if present.
      maxImageWidth - A double which represents the maximum width of the image.
      maxImageHeight - A double which represents the maximum height of the image.
      Returns:
      Returns a double which represents the height of the picture.

    • setUpInformation

      public double setUpInformation​(java.lang.String information, double maxStringWidth, double maxStringHeight, boolean message)
      Sets up the information so that it can be added to the billboard, given a maximum string height and width. Returns the height of the label for formatting and spacing purposes.
      Parameters:
      information - A String which stores the information to display.
      maxStringWidth - A double which represents the maximum width of the information label.
      maxStringHeight - A double which represents the maximum height of the information label.
      message - A boolean which is true if there is a message also being displayed and false if there isn't.
      Returns:
      Returns a double which represents the height of the information.

    • setGridBagConstraints

      public static java.awt.GridBagConstraints setGridBagConstraints​(int gridx, int gridy, int gridHeight, int topPadding, int bottomPadding)
      Sets the grid bag constraints for an element which will be added to the billboard.
      Parameters:
      gridx - An int which is the x position of the element.
      gridy - An int which is the y position of the element.
      gridHeight - An int which is the grid height of the element.
      topPadding - An int which is the padding to add on the top of the element.
      bottomPadding - An int which is the padding to add on the bottom of the element.
      Returns:
      Returns a GridBagConstraints which has all of the parameters as constraints.

    • messageOnlyBillboard

      public void messageOnlyBillboard​(java.lang.String message)
      Displays a billboard which has only a message. The is displayed in the centre of the screen with the maximum possible font size.
      Parameters:
      message - A String which stores the message to display.

    • pictureOnlyBillboard

      public void pictureOnlyBillboard​(java.lang.String picture, java.lang.String pictureType, byte[] pictureData)
      Displays a billboard which has only a picture. The picture takes up no more than 50% of the screen height and no more than 50% of the screen width. The picture is displayed in the centre of the screen.
      Parameters:
      picture - A String which stores the picture to display, in the form of a url or data attribute.
      pictureType - A String which specifies the type of picture, either as a "url", "data" or "byte".
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute if present.

    • informationOnlyBillboard

      public void informationOnlyBillboard​(java.lang.String information)
      Displays a billboard which only has information. The information takes up no more than 75% of the screen's width and 50% of the screen's height. The information is displayed in the centre of the screen.
      Parameters:
      information - A String which stores the information to display.

    • messagePictureBillboard

      public void messagePictureBillboard​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String picture, java.lang.String pictureType, byte[] pictureData)
      Displays a billboard which has a message and a picture. The picture is displayed in the center of the bottom 2/3 of the screen, and the message is displayed in the center of the remaining top part of the screen.
      Parameters:
      message - A String which stores the message to display.
      picture - A String which stores the picture to display, in the form of a url or data attribute.
      pictureType - A String which specifies the type of picture, either as a "url", "data" or "byte".
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute if present.

    • messageInformationBillboard

      public void messageInformationBillboard​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String information)
      Displays a billboard which has a message and information. The message is displayed in the center of the top half of the screen and the information is displayed in the center of the bottom half of the screen. The message font size is always larger than the information font size.
      Parameters:
      message - A String which stores the message to display.
      information - A String which stores the information to display

    • pictureInformationBillboard

      public void pictureInformationBillboard​(java.lang.String picture, java.lang.String pictureType, byte[] pictureData, java.lang.String information)
      Displays a billboard which has a picture and information. The picture is displayed in the center of the top 2/3 of the screen, and the information is displayed in the center of the remaining bottom part of the screen.
      Parameters:
      picture - A String which stores the picture to display, in the form of a url or data attribute.
      pictureType - A String which specifies the type of picture, either as a "url", "data" or "byte".
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute if present.
      information - A String which stores the information to display.

    • allFeaturesBillboard

      public void allFeaturesBillboard​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String picture, java.lang.String pictureType, byte[] pictureData, java.lang.String information)
      Displays a billboard which has all the features: a message, picture and information. The picture is displayed in the centre of the screen, the message is displayed in the remaining top part of the screen, and the information is displayed in the remaining bottom part of the screen.
      Parameters:
      message - A String which stores the message to display.
      picture - A String which stores the picture to display, in the form of a url or data attribute.
      pictureType - A String which specifies the type of picture, either as a "url", "data" or "byte".
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute if present.
      information - A String which stores the information to display.

    • formatBillboard

      public void formatBillboard​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> billboardData, byte[] pictureData)
      Formats the display window using depending on whether there is a message, picture, information or any combination of the three.
      Parameters:
      billboardData - A HashMap(String, String) which stores the background colour, message, message colour, picture, picture type (data or url), information, and information colour of the billboard, if there is no content for one or more of these tags, the string is null.
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute if present.

    • setupBillboard

      public void setupBillboard()
      Sets up the basic layout of the billboard.

    • listenEscapeKey

      public void listenEscapeKey()
      Exits the window if the user presses the escape key.

    • listenMouseClick

      public void listenMouseClick()
      Exits the window if the user clicks anywhere on the window.

    • showViewer

      public void showViewer()
      Shows the GUI to display the Viewer.

    • displaySpecialMessage

      public void displaySpecialMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Displays just a special message on the billboard e.g. an error message.
      Parameters:
      message - A String which represents the message to display on the screen.

    • displayBillboard

      public void displayBillboard​(java.lang.String billboardXML, byte[] pictureData)
      Displays the billboard on the viewer.
      Parameters:
      billboardXML - A String which stores the xml file to be displayed.
      pictureData - A byte[] array which stores the picture data attribute.
